citations.narrative:
At the time of inspection, a six-month-old female poodle identified as “Maria” was observed running around the enclosure
having a long piece of loose wire was entangled in the hair of her right rear leg. The entangled wire is a potential source
of injury to the animal. Housing facilities for dogs must be designed and constructed so that they are structurally sound,
kept in good repair, and they must protect the animals from injury.
Licensee corrected by removing the wire at the time of inspection.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with licensee.
Additional Inspectors:
MICHAEL TYGART, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n

narrative:
3.1(a) 
   
Housing facilities, general. 
At the time of inspection, a six-month-old female poodle identified as “Maria” was observed running around the enclosure 
having a long piece of loose wire was entangled in the hair of her right rear leg. The entangled wire is a potential source 
of injury to the animal. Housing facilities for dogs must be designed and constructed so that they are structurally sound, 
kept in good repair, and they must protect the animals from injury. 
Licensee corrected by removing the wire at the time of inspection. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with licensee. 
 
Additional Inspectors: 
MICHAEL TYGART, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n
